## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron ore mining and smelting setup at (15.5, 70.5)
- Electric mining drill at (15.5, 70.5) facing DOWN (output at 15.5, 72.5)
- Small electric pole at (13.5, 69.5) powering the drill
- Stone furnace at (16.0, 74.0) facing UP
- Wooden chest at (16.5, 74.5)
- Transport belts connecting drill to furnace (positions: (15.5,72.5) to (24.5,70.5))

### Remote iron smelting setup at (26.0, 71.0)
- Stone furnace at (26.0, 71.0) facing LEFT
- Transport belts connecting to main mining setup

### Power generation setup at (-9.5, -0.5)
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 0.5) connected via pipes to:
- Boiler at (-5.0, 3.5) (currently out of fuel)
- Steam engine at (-0.5, 3.5) (not connected to power network)
- Pipe network connecting offshore pump to boiler (positions: (-8.5,-0.5), (-6.5,-0.5), (-7.5,-0.5), (-4.5,-0.5), (-5.5,-0.5), (-3.5,-0.5))
- Power pole at (3.5, 3.5) connecting the system

## ERROR TIPS

### Placement collision errors (repeated 8 times)
- Verify target position is clear before placing entities (chests/inserters/furnaces)
- Check for existing objects at target location before placement attempts
- Avoid placing furnaces near water or other unplaceable terrain

### Belt connection errors
- Transport belts cannot connect directly to furnaces - requires inserters as intermediaries
- Plan belt routes before placement to avoid crossing existing structures

### Inserter placement issues (3 occurrences)
- Ensure proper spacing between furnaces and output chests for inserter placement
- Verify inserter orientation matches input/output directions

### Power system problems
- Add fuel to boiler to enable steam generation
- Verify power connections between steam engine and power poles
- Check energy levels of connected machines after establishing connections

### Smelting setup optimization
- Place furnaces closer to mining drills to minimize belt requirements
- Verify furnace orientation matches belt input/output directions
- Ensure complete fuel supply chain before expecting smelting operations

### Placement sequence planning
- Survey area for obstacles before attempting placements
- Plan complete mining/smelting setups before placement to avoid rework
- Maintain proper spacing between connected production chain components
